required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: New Foods Take Time, a Curriculum Designed to Promote Tasting and Liking of Fruits and Vegetables
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluating "New Foods Take Time", a Classroom-based Curriculum Designed to Promote Tasting and Liking of Fruits and Vegetables Among Head Start Preschool Children

brief_summary.textblock: The overall objective of this project is to conduct a preliminary evaluation of the "New Foods Take Time" Intervention in Head Start preschool classrooms.

detailed_description.textblock: The overall objective of this project is to conduct a preliminary evaluation of the "New Foods Take Time" Intervention. This curriculum is designed to increase children's preference for and consumption of fruits and vegetables (FV) by encouraging children to try new FV and repeatedly taste these foods.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Classrooms will receive "New Foods Take Time", a series of 5 interactive lessons. Children, parents, and teachers will participate in the research

primary_outcome.measure: Change in number of foods tasted
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre intervention and at conclusion of 5 week intervention
primary_outcome.description: Children will be presented with small portions of familiar and novel fruits and vegetables and be asked if they would like to taste them

primary_outcome.measure: Change in liking of study foods
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre intervention and at conclusion of 5 week intervention
primary_outcome.description: For foods that children agree to taste, they will be asked to rate their liking of them on a three point likert-type scale ("Yummy", "Just ok", or "Yucky")

primary_outcome.measure: Change in self-competence to try new foods
primary_outcome.time_frame: Pre intervention and at conclusion of 5 week intervention
primary_outcome.description: Children will be presented with a series pairs of drawings with descriptions (e.g., "This boy likes to try new foods" and "This boy does not like to try new foods") and asked to select which is most like them.
Teachers will complete a questionnaire with scaled and open-ended questions about the feasibility and acceptability of the intervention

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured once at any time between enrollment and conclusion of 5 week intervention
other_outcome.description: Height and weight will be measured and used to calculate body mass index (BMI). Age and sex specific percentiles/z-scores will be calculated using CDC growth standards.

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured once at any time between enrollment and conclusion of 5 week intervention
other_outcome.description: Parents will complete a survey about their child's eating behavior

other_outcome.time_frame: Measured once at any time between enrollment and conclusion of 5 week intervention
other_outcome.description: Parents will complete the USDA food security questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Change in intake of study foods
other_outcome.time_frame: Pre intervention and at conclusion of 5 week intervention
other_outcome.description: The number of pieces of each food eaten during the tasting procedure

arm_group.description: Head Start classrooms will receive "New Foods Take Time", a series of five interactive weekly lessons designed to promote children's willingness to try new foods, particularly fruits and vegetables. Lessons will be delivered by nutrition educations. Children will also receive three tastings per week of the new foods discussed during the lessons.

intervention.description: New Foods Take Time is a series of 5 classroom lessons focused on increasing children's willingness to try fruits and vegetables.

criteria.textblock:
Child Inclusion Criteria:
- Enrolled in a Head Start preschool center
- Between the ages of 2 and 5 years old
Child Exclusion Criteria:
- Food allergy or restriction to foods in the tastings
Parent Inclusion Criteria:
- Parent or primary caregiver of a child enrolled in the study
- Age 18 years or older
- English speaking
Parent Exclusion Criteria:
- None
Teacher Inclusion Criteria:
- Actively employed as an early childhood education provider in the Head Start classroom where the intervention is delivered
- Age 18 years or older
Teacher Exclusion Criteria:
- None

patient_data.ipd_description: Deidentified individual participant data will be available from the principal investigator upon request
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available after publication of primary outcomes
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Requests for access to the data will be reviewed and approved at the principal investigator's discretion.
